snippet: The prime minister’s pledge to hold elections next month reflects worries that his economic revival program and his popularity are faltering, experts say.
abstract: Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe calls for early elections, framing move as a broad referendum on his economic recovery measures; decision reflects worries that program of so-called 'Abenomics' is faltering; measures succeed in spurring recovery and lifting the stock market, but fail to end a long income slide for average citizens.
lead_paragraph: The prime minister’s pledge to hold elections next month reflects worries that his economic revival program and his popularity are faltering, experts say.

headline.main: Calling Early Elections in Japan, Abe Rolls the Dice on the Economy
headline.print_headline: Calling Early Elections in Japan, Abe Rolls the Dice on the Economy
